segment.source: Deny log on as a batch job (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deny log on as a batch job (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on as a batch job security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on as a batch job security policy setting.

segment.source: Deny log on as a batch job
segment.target: Deny log on as a batch job

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on as a batch job security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on as a batch job security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which accounts are prevented from logging on by using a batch-queue tool to schedule and start jobs automatically in the future.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which accounts are prevented from logging on by using a batch-queue tool to schedule and start jobs automatically in the future.

segment.source: The ability to log on by using a batch-queue tool is needed for any account that is used to start scheduled jobs by means of the Task Scheduler.
segment.target: The ability to log on by using a batch-queue tool is needed for any account that is used to start scheduled jobs by means of the Task Scheduler.

segment.source: When you assign this user right, thoroughly test that the effect is what you intended.
segment.target: When you assign this user right, thoroughly test that the effect is what you intended.

segment.source: Within a domain, modify this setting on the applicable Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: Within a domain, modify this setting on the applicable Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: Deny log on as a batch job prevents administrators or operators from using their personal accounts to schedule tasks, which helps with business continuity when that person transitions to other positions or responsibilities.
segment.target: Deny log on as a batch job prevents administrators or operators from using their personal accounts to schedule tasks, which helps with business continuity when that person transitions to other positions or responsibilities.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: This policy setting might conflict with and negate the Log on as a batch job setting.
segment.target: This policy setting might conflict with and negate the Log on as a batch job setting.

segment.source: On a domain-joined device, including the domain controller, this policy can be overwritten by a domain policy, which will prevent you from modifying the local policy setting.
segment.target: On a domain-joined device, including the domain controller, this policy can be overwritten by a domain policy, which will prevent you from modifying the local policy setting.

segment.source: For example, if you are trying to configure Task Scheduler on your domain controller, check the Settings tab of your two domain controller policy and domain policy GPOs in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: For example, if you are trying to configure Task Scheduler on your domain controller, check the Settings tab of your two domain controller policy and domain policy GPOs in the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: Verify the targeted account is not present in the Deny log on as a batch job
segment.target: Verify the targeted account is not present in the Deny log on as a batch job

segment.source: User Rights Assignment and also correctly configured in the Log on as a batch job setting.
segment.target: User Rights Assignment and also correctly configured in the Log on as a batch job setting.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Accounts that have the Deny log on as a batch job user right could be used to schedule jobs that could consume excessive computer resources and cause a denial-of-service condition.
segment.target: Accounts that have the Deny log on as a batch job user right could be used to schedule jobs that could consume excessive computer resources and cause a denial-of-service condition.

segment.source: Assign the Deny log on as a batch job user right to the local Guest account.
segment.target: Assign the Deny log on as a batch job user right to the local Guest account.

segment.source: If you assign the Deny log on as a batch job user right to other accounts, you could deny the ability to perform required job activities to users who are assigned specific administrative roles.
segment.target: If you assign the Deny log on as a batch job user right to other accounts, you could deny the ability to perform required job activities to users who are assigned specific administrative roles.

segment.source: You should confirm that delegated tasks are not affected adversely.
segment.target: You should confirm that delegated tasks are not affected adversely.
